abstract.text: A container for uniform shader data.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: object is used to hold uniform data for a custom OpenGL or OpenGL ES shader. The uniform data is accessible from all shaders that include the uniform.To use a uniform variable in your shader, create the
object and set its initial value. Once its value is specified, the
property changes to match the type of the initial value you provided and can never change afterward. To use the uniform object, add it to an
object that needs to access the uniform variable. To update the uniform variable’s value, choose the appropriate property on the uniform object based on the data type it encapsulates.

abstract.text: Add high-performance 2D content with smooth animations to your app, or create a game with a high-level set of 2D game-based tools.

The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.

You should only read or write the property type that matches the type of the uniform object; it is a programming error to use any of the other properties.
